intro: Allocarya macbridei, commonly known as the MacBride's starling grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the grasslands of central Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pale green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, three-lobed seed pods. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly wavy margin, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Allocarya macbridei is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
